title.value: Learning Inter-Modal Correspondence and Phenotypes from Multi-Modal Electronic Health Records
title.justification: The title is directly extracted from the beginning of the paper, which clearly states the main focus of the research.
title.quote: Learning Inter-Modal Correspondence and Phenotypes from Multi-Modal Electronic Health Records

extractions.description: The paper presents a novel framework called collective Hidden Interaction Tensor Factorization (cHITF) for modeling inter-modal correspondences in multi-modal electronic health records (EHR). It builds on non-negative tensor factorization to improve the discovery of phenotypes without the need for pre-defined inter-modal interactions, which are often unavailable in real-world datasets. The study demonstrates the effectiveness of cHITF using the MIMIC-III and eICU datasets, providing clinically relevant and diverse phenotypes with improved predictive performance.

type.justification: The paper conducts extensive experiments using real-world datasets like MIMIC-III and eICU to validate the proposed cHITF framework.
type.quote: Extensive experiments conducted on the real-world MIMIC-III dataset demonstrate that cHITF effectively infers clinically meaningful inter-modal correspondence, discovers phenotypes that are more clinically relevant and diverse, and achieves better predictive performance compared with a number of state-of-the-art computational phenotyping models.

name.justification: The research focuses on enhancing electronic health records (EHR) data analysis to discover meaningful phenotypes, which is directly related to Healthcare Informatics.
name.quote: Non-negative tensor factorization has been shown a practical solution to automatically discover phenotypes from the electronic health records (EHR)...

name.justification: The paper utilizes and extends tensor factorization methods such as CP and non-negative tensor factorization.
name.quote: Among the efforts, the non-negative tensor CP factorization has been found particularly promising.

name.justification: The main goal of the research is to improve phenotype discovery from EHR data using machine learning techniques.
name.quote: ...applying machine learning methods, especially the unsupervised ones, to automatically extract phenotypes from large-scale EHR data without intensive human supervision has been gaining increasing attention recently.

name.justification: The paper introduces cHITF as its main contribution to tackle inter-modal correspondence in phenotyping.
name.quote: we propose the collective hidden interaction tensor factorization (cHITF) to infer the correspondence between multiple modalities jointly with the phenotype discovery.

is_contributed.justification: The cHITF model is a novel contribution of the paper to the field of EHR phenotyping.
is_contributed.quote: To alleviate this problem and discover phenotypes from EHR with unobserved inter-modal correspondence, we propose the collective hidden interaction tensor factorization (cHITF)...

is_executed.justification: The model has been executed in experiments using real-world datasets such as MIMIC-III and eICU.
is_executed.quote: ...experiments based on the real-world MIMIC-III and eICU datasets...

is_compared.justification: The paper compares cHITF's performance against several baseline models in various tasks.
is_compared.quote: ...achieves better predictive performance compared with a number of state-of-the-art computational phenotyping models.

referenced_paper_title.justification: There is no previous work cited as a basis for cHITF, since it is the novel contribution of this paper.

name.justification: The paper introduces HITF as a model to infer hidden interactions between two modalities within the cHITF framework.
name.quote: We first present the building block of our framework, the Hidden Interaction Tensor Factorization (HITF) model.

is_contributed.justification: HITF is a newly introduced model as part of the cHITF framework.
is_contributed.quote: ...the Hidden Interaction Tensor Factorization (HITF) model, which aims at discovering the hidden correspondence...

is_executed.justification: The HITF model is executed as part of the experiments within the paper.
is_executed.quote: We conducted extensive experiments based on the real-world MIMIC-III and eICU datasets.

is_compared.justification: HITF is evaluated for its ability to infer meaningful correspondences, thus implicitly compared to baseline assumptions like equal-correspondence.
is_compared.quote: The inter-modal correspondence inferred by HITF are significantly better than baselines.

referenced_paper_title.justification: There is no previous work cited as a basis for HITF, since it is the novel contribution of this paper.

name.justification: MIMIC-III is one of the primary datasets used in the experiments to test the proposed model.
name.quote: Extensive experiments conducted on the real-world MIMIC-III dataset demonstrate that cHITF...

referenced_paper_title.value: MIMIC-III, a freely accessible critical care database
referenced_paper_title.justification: MIMIC-III is a well-known dataset mentioned in the context of the study, and its reference is typically acknowledged.
referenced_paper_title.quote: MIMIC-III, a freely accessible critical care database
